page.title: 08TRADE AND TRANSPORT
page.content: {General Survey.}In Runcorn there are many forms of transport.Mainly used for pleasure,is the Bridgewater canal. The Manchester Ship Canal carries ocean going ships.Both canals link Runcorn with Manchester.Two Inter City railway lines cross in Runcorn; the electric line joins Liverpool to the south and the diesel line links Warrington with Chester and N.Wales Runcorn is on the final approach to Liverpool (Speke) airport. Minor and estate roads join our town up,but larger main roads link us with the rest of Britain.Some of them are dual carriage ways called Expressways. Busways used only by buses join the Shopping City with all areas of the town.Neighbourhood shopping centres, mobile shops, and doorstep deliveries provide further retail facilities.
